intro: Ornithogalum lebaense, commonly known as the Ethiopian star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous perennial plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, ovoid bulbs that are used for propagation. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ornithogalum lebaense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
